articles.title: Cannabis for COVID-19: Canadian research claims extracts from the psychoactive drug could fight coronavirus - Times Now
articles.description: The study found that extracts from cannabis can affect the ACE-2 receptors in the host cells. ACE2 receptors are proteins that have been found to be the "entry points" for coronavirus in the host's body.
